intro: Geranium chaparense, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Geranium chaparense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
